Some common mistakes that defenders make while trying to tackle in rugby league are:

1. Poor tackling technique: Defenders may not get their positioning and technique right when attempting a tackle. This can lead to ineffective tackles or even missed tackles.

2. Overcommitting: Defenders may rush in too quickly, leaving gaps in the defensive line. This can create opportunities for the attacking team to break through and score.

3. Failing to communicate: Defenders may not communicate effectively with their teammates, leading to confusion and gaps in the defensive line.

4. Holding on too long: Defenders may hold on to the ball carrier for too long, resulting in penalties for not releasing the ball.

5. Going for the big hit: Defenders may try to go for a big hit instead of focusing on making a proper tackle. This can result in missed tackles or the ball carrier breaking through the tackle.

6. Targeting the wrong area: Defenders may target the wrong area on the ball carrier's body, such as going for the upper body instead of the legs. This can make it easier for the ball carrier to break through the tackle.

By avoiding these common mistakes, defenders can improve their tackling and be more effective at stopping the opposition's attack.
